subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|女|t1=woman|賓|ls=psc|c1=s|c2=p}} – a kind of woman, a court lady or maid. 賓 also means “obey, submit”, hence connotations of “an obedient woman, a maid”.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: Endopassive form of {{och-l|賓|to receive like a guest}}.

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[court]] [[lady]]
# [[palace]] [[maid]]
# {{lb|zh|archaic}} a posthumous name for [[wife|wives]] in [[w:ancestor veneration in China|Zhou ritual]]
#* The ''[[w:Book of Rites|Book of Rites]]'', Qu Li II, 122:
#*: 生曰[[父]]、曰[[母]]、曰[[妻]]，死曰考、曰[[妣]]、曰'''嬪'''。
#*: ''While alive, the names of '[[父|father]]', '[[母|mother]]', and '[[妻|wife]]' are used; when they are dead, those of '[[考|the completed one]]', '[[妣|the corresponding one]]', and ''''the honored one''''.''
